column1: # Submission Type I
# PREDICTION SECTION
# Fill one typeI_microscopic_pKas_and_microstates.csv template for all molecules predicted with the same method.
# For each molecule
column2: report as many microscopic pKas as your method predicts.

column1: # Add new lines for each microstate pair.
# Report microscopic pKa values to two decimal places (e.g. 10.71).
# Reporting the standard error of the mean (SEM) is optional
column3: two decimal places should be provided (e.g. 1.02).

column1: # For values which you don't have an estimate
column2: leave that cell of the csv table empty.

column1: # The data in each prediction line should be structured as follows:
# microstate ID of protonated state(HA)
# The list of predictions must begin with the "Prediction:" keyword
Predictions:

# Please provide an informal yet informative name of the method used.
# The "Name:" keyword is required
Name:
# SOFTWARE SECTION
# All major software packages used and their versions.
# Create a new line for each software.
# The "Software:" keyword is required.
Software:

# Methodology and computational details.
# Level of detail should be at least that used in a publication.
# Please include the values of key parameters
column3: and explain how any statistical uncertainties were estimated.

column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.

Method:
